objects.name: Header_Txt_Object
objects.string:
Through our pioneering, online Adventure Academic App (AAA) Series, you will Pilot a RoboQuest Robotic Spaceship to Harvest Asteroids for Precious Gems (Minecraft-style), equipped with Rapid-Firing Organic-Projectiles and other Family-Friendly Devices.  
 
Through our Built-in ‘Play Smart/Work-Smart’ Quiz Questions, you will Engage in Missions to Explore College/High-School Robotic Concepts such as: 
* Differential-Steering for Navigational-Motion,
* H-Bridge Current-Polarity for Driving both Left & Right DC-Motors, and
* Pulse-Width-Modulation (PWM) to Control a Servo’s Rotation-Angle.
 
Also featured is our Online RoboQuest-Derby, where you engage in a friendly, high-adrenaline International Co-op Competition with other amazing students/pilots across the globe/galaxy.  ; ) 

Specs: 
* Chrome-Browser: Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, Linux
* Full-Stack Web w/ Peer-to-Peer & Google FireStore(FireBase)
* Multiplayer Drop-In Anytime

'repeast for each instance of' each object'
* A "For Each" event is a special event that takes an object as a parameter. While the game is running, all of the conditions and actions located inside this event will be repeated for every instance of the object.
** Thus avoid using for max speed
* Most of the time, a "For Each" event is not required because conditions and actions automatically run on all instances of an object. Using a "For Each" when it is not required will cause the computer to do extra work and may lower the performance of a game.

events.comment: Add related actions to selected object either 1) within same event_block or 2) as sub_event_block
Subnest all Supporting Objects under the Above 'player_Ship' Object
Relatively real-time, so keep timer delay at minimal: 0.1 = 10 triggers/sec, 0.2 = 5 triggers/sec, 0.4 = 2.5 trigger/sec
Create Player Shield: Only for Local Player_Version since Complicated Algorithm to Migrate Position Value to Remote Player_Version

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (@arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MQTT
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An MQTT client for GDevelop: allow connections to a MQTT server and send/receive messages.
description: This extension wraps [MQTT.js](https://github.com/mqttjs/MQTT.js) to allow connections to a MQTT server and communication via pub/sub. The only transport method is Websockets. Make sure to use a broker that support those!
# Dataloss

The dataloss let you chose how to handle data. Due to how the GDevelop event loop is made, only one message per topic can be processed per frame. When dataloss is on, when you get 2 messages from one topic in one frame, only the latest one is remembered. When it is off, the first message is processed and the second is queued for the next frame.
# QoS (Quality of service)
Here is how QoS works:
- QoS 0 (received at most once): The packet is sent, and that's it. There is no validation about whether it has been received.

- QoS 1 (received at least once): The packet is sent and stored as long as the client has not received a confirmation from the server. MQTT ensures that it will be received, but there can be duplicates.
- QoS 2 (received exactly once): Same as QoS 1 but there is no duplicates.
About data consumption: QoS 2 will consume more than QoS 1, which will consume more than QoS 0.

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the client is connected to an MQTT broker server.
eventsFunctions.name: isConnected

eventsFunctions.description: Connects to an MQTT broker.
eventsFunctions.name: connect
eventsFunctions.sentence: Connect to MQTT broker _PARAM1_ with parameters _PARAM2_ (secure connection: _PARAM3_)

parameters.longDescription:
You can find the list of settings at [the MQTT.js docs](https://github.com/mqttjs/MQTT.js/#client).  
An example of valid configuration would be `"{\"clientId\": \"myUserName\"}"`.
parameters.name: settings

eventsFunctions.description: Disconnects from the current MQTT broker.
eventsFunctions.name: disconnect

parameters.longDescription: By default, MQTT waits for pending messages or messages in the process of being sent to finish being sent before ending the connection. Use this to cancel any request and immediately shutdown the connection.
parameters.name: force

eventsFunctions.description: Publishes a message on a topic.
eventsFunctions.name: publish

parameters.longDescription:
When a message is retained, it will be sent to every client that subscribe to the topic. Only one message can be retained per topic, if another retained message is sent it will overwrite the previous one.  
Read more [here](https://www.hivemq.com/blog/mqtt-essentials-part-8-retained-messages/#retained-messages).
parameters.name: retain

eventsFunctions.description: Subcribe to a topic. All messages published on that topic will be received.
eventsFunctions.name: subscribe
eventsFunctions.sentence: Subscribe to topic _PARAM1_ with QoS at _PARAM2_ and dataloss _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Unsubcribe from a topic. No more messages from this topic will be received.
eventsFunctions.name: unsubscribe

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers whenever a message was received. Note that you first need to subcribe to a topic in order to get messages from it.
eventsFunctions.name: onMessage

eventsFunctions.description: Get the last received message of a topic.
eventsFunctions.name: GetLastMessage

parameters.description: The topic to get the message from
parameters.name: topic

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the last error. Returns an empty string if there was no errors.
eventsFunctions.name: getCurrentError

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedP2PEventHandling
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows handling all received P2P events at once instead of one per frame. It is more complex but also potentially more performant.
description: Allows handling all events at once instead of one per frame.
### Usage:
![Screenshot of the way to use the extension](https://i.imgur.com/DkYfM7W.png)

eventsFunctions.description: Marks the event as handled, to go on to the next.
eventsFunctions.name: DissmissEvent

eventsFunctions.description: Description: network_Receive_EventName_WithDataOut_Fn

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: WebSocketClient
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A WebSocket client for fast client-server networking.
description: This extension allows to use WebSocket based networking.
You can use it to interact with a WebSocket based API, or a server for your multiplayer game.
Features:
- Connection and disconnection from a server
- Receiving strings from the server
- Sending strings to the server
- Error handling
- Handling more than 1 event per frame
Doesn't contain:
- Sending or receiving binary data
- A WebSocket server

inlineCode: /** The current connection to the WebSockets server. */

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the client is currently connecting to the WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: IsConnecting

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the client is connected to a WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: IsConnected

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the connection to a WebSocket server was closed.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Connection to a server was closed
eventsFunctions.name: IsClosed

eventsFunctions.description: Connects to a WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: Connect

eventsFunctions.description: Disconnects from the current WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: Disconnect

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers when the server has sent the client some data.
eventsFunctions.name: EventReceived

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the piece of data from the server that is currently being processed.
eventsFunctions.name: Data

eventsFunctions.description: Dismisses an event after processing it to allow processing the next one without waiting for the next frame.
eventsFunctions.name: FinalizeEvent

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a string to the server.
eventsFunctions.name: Send

parameters.description: The data to send to the server
parameters.name: data

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers when a WebSocket error has occurred.
eventsFunctions.name: OnError

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the last error that occurred.
eventsFunctions.name: LastError
